intro: Treutlera, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Convolvulaceae. It is native to Central America and parts of the southern United States, where it thrives in warm, sunny environments. The plants are characterized by their showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. Treutlera species typically have heart-shaped leaves and produce cylindrical, spirally twisted fruits. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
